main_question: When must a federal election be held according to legislation passed by Parliament?
possible_answers: A. When the King wants to replace the Prime Minister
B. Within 4 years of the most recent election
C. Within 5 years of the last election
D. The Prime Minister can call the election any time at his own will
answer: B. Within 4 years of the most recent election
explanatory_sentence: Under legislation passed by Parliament, federal elections must be held on the third Monday in October every four years following the most recent general election.
